thread.title: Defending champion Kei Nishikori books Japan Open semi-final place
thread.title_full: Defending champion Kei Nishikori books Japan Open semi-final place

title: Defending champion Kei Nishikori books Japan Open semi-final place
text:
Defending champion Kei Nishikori books Japan Open semi-final place 09 Oct 2015 10:01:52 
comments 
Reigning champion Kei Nishikori came from a set down to beat Marin Cilic at the Rakuten Japan Open on Friday and set up a semi-final meeting with Frenchman Benoit Paire. 
In a match that lasted two hours and 11 minutes, home favourite and second seed Nishikori - winner of this tournament both last year and in 2012 - bounced back against Croatia's sixth seed Cilic to triumph 3-6 7-5 6-3. 
His next opponent Paire also came from behind to progress, defeating Australia's Nick Kyrgios 3-6 6-4 6-1. 
The other last-four meeting will be between top seed Stan Wawrinka and Gilles Muller. 
Wawrinka eased past American qualifier Austin Krajicek, the Swiss running out a 6-3 6-4 winner. 
Meanwhile, Luxembourg's Muller sprung a surprise as he saw off French third seed Gilles Simon, ranked 33 places above him at world number 10, 6-3 6-4. Related Sport News
